TEXT: The applicant PERSON is a NORP national , who was born in DATE . He is a lawyer and a member of ORG . He is not represented before the ORG . The respondent Government are represented by their Agent , PERSON , Director in ORG .
The facts of the case , as submitted by the parties , may be summarised as follows .

As from DATE onwards the applicant represented his clients together with Professor PERSON , a professor of law , in criminal proceedings in which the applicant ’s clients were complainants . On DATE ORG ( käräjäoikeus , tingsrätten ) of GPE rejected the claims submitted on behalf of the applicant ’s clients . The applicant and PERSON submitted a lengthy ( CARDINAL pages ) notice of appeal to ORG ( hovioikeus , hovrätten ) of GPE on behalf of their clients , criticising ORG decision and related procedural matters .

ORG , PERSON ) sent a letter to the applicant on DATE , informing him that the presiding judge in the above - mentioned proceedings , J. , had complained to ORG about the allegedly defamatory language used by the applicant in the notice of appeal . The language was described by J. as being below acceptable standards and inappropriate for a member of ORG . She also stated her dissatisfaction with the way the applicant had belittled her reasoning . In her opinion it was alleged several times that she had judged the case arbitrarily . The applicant was invited to submit his observations .
The applicant submitted his response to the complaint to ORG on DATE , denying all the allegations and arguing also that the complaints were unspecified .

On DATE ORG of ORG decided to transfer the complaint to ORG ( kurinpitolautakunta , disciplinnämnden ) . The decision was communicated to the applicant by sending him a copy of the relevant part of TIME of the meeting from which it appeared that ORG had drafted a list of the allegedly defamatory statements included in the notice of appeal . The list was CARDINAL pages long , consisting of CARDINAL references to the notice of appeal .
On DATE the applicant submitted his further comments to ORG , insisting that J. be told to particularise her complaints .

On DATE the observations were communicated to J. , who was informed that the correspondence had been terminated and that ORG would examine the matter in its meeting on CARDINAL DATE and that she would be informed of the decision . A copy of the letter was also sent to the applicant .

According to the ORG , ORG examined the case in CARDINAL meetings . On DATE , the examination of the case was postponed and a copy of the minutes was served upon the applicant on DATE . ORG resumed its examination and decided the case on DATE . A copy of the record was served upon the applicant on DATE . When deciding the case , ORG also decided that an abstract of the case , which did not disclose the applicant ’s identity , be published in ORG , ORG journal . The wording of the abstract was approved in ORG meeting on CARDINAL DATE and it was published DATE . The Government admit that some of the information provided to the applicant concerning the proceedings was incorrect .

According to the applicant , he was informed , after inquiry about the state of the proceedings , that the examination of his case had been adjourned until DATE . After that meeting he was informed that the case was adjourned until the meeting of CARDINAL DATE . Contrary to the above information however the applicant received , on DATE , a copy of ORG decision , stating that ORG had decided on DATE to give him a warning . Regardless of his inquiries addressed to ORG , the applicant claims that he is still unaware of the date on which the decision was actually made .
ORG decision of CARDINAL DATE reads :
“ ORG of ORG has examined a complaint made by ORG concerning attorney A and noted the following :

A has in an appeal to ORG together with another person named and criticised the presiding judge PERSON has submitted that the reason for his criticism was the fact that the decision which dismissed his claims by CARDINAL vote turned on the opinion of the presiding judge . In the lengthy notice of appeal the presiding judge was criticised in , inter alia , the following terms :

J. ’s conduct seems goal - directed .
J. began her decision with an unintelligent statement .

According to the attorney ’s code of conduct an attorney is , when appealing against a judgment , not allowed to use belittling expressions of the court or in any other manner subject the court ’s work or its decisions to impertinent criticism .

ORG notes that apart from the expressions given as examples above , the notice of appeal as a whole contains belittling and impertinent criticism aimed personally at the presiding judge of the court . In some of the statements cited above PERSON is referred to as being guilty of lack of judgment , prejudice , falsification of facts and partiality in CARDINAL party ’s favour . If this were to be proven correct , it would mean that PERSON has abused her office . A has not submitted that he has taken any legal steps in that regard . ORG issues a warning . ”

ORG is a registered entity and its duties are set out in legislation . Apart from protecting the interests of its members , it has certain public duties by virtue of LAW ( laki asianajajista , lagen om advokater DATE ) .
According to section CARDINAL ( CARDINAL ) of LAW , a member of the Association shall , inter alia , be DATE , have full legal capacity and be honest and suitable for acting as attorney .

Section CARDINAL imposes a duty upon ORG of ORG to ensure that the attorneys comply with their obligations . By virtue of section CARDINAL ( CARDINAL ) disciplinary powers are vested in ORG . This body is independent , but any decision to expel a member must , however , be submitted to ORG for approval . By virtue of section CARDINAL ( CARDINAL ) the members of ORG must act judicially when deciding disciplinary matters against an attorney , as must the members of ORG by virtue of section CARDINAL ( CARDINAL ) .

Under section CARDINAL , ORG has an obligation to take , when necessary , disciplinary measures . Such measures must be taken , if the member has intentionally acted in a wrongful or dishonest manner , neglected his , or her , obligations as an attorney , acted in violation of the attorney ’s code of conduct or committed an act which may be harmful to the reputation of the legal profession . The disciplinary measures consist of expulsion , issuing a public warning , a non - public warning or an admonition .

For instance , if the member has acted in violation of the attorney ’s code of conduct , he must be issued with an admonition or a warning , or , if the circumstances are grave , be expelled from ORG .

An attorney , who has been expelled or given a public warning , has under LAW ( CARDINAL ) of LAW the right to appeal against the decision to ORG of GPE , which has full jurisdiction in the case . Under subsection CARDINAL , the Chancellor of ORG has the right to appeal against any decisions on disciplinary matters . Thus , the attorney concerned has no appeal against a written warning given by ORG , unless ORG has decided to make the warning public .

The provisions in LAW ( oikeudenkäymiskaari , rättegångsbalken ) concerning the right to an oral hearing before ORG were amended by an act ( PERSON ) which entered into force on CARDINAL DATE , i.e. after ORG gave its decision in the present case , but before it was served upon the applicant . By virtue of the entry into force and the transitional provisions the new provisions apply to a case that after their entry into force become pending before ORG as the court of first instance .

According to the new provisions in LAW , inter alia , chapter CARDINAL , section DATE , an oral hearing shall be held in ORG , if a party to a civil case or the injured party or the defendant in a criminal case so requests . However , such a hearing need not be held for the reasons mentioned above if , inter alia , the holding of a hearing is manifestly unnecessary .

Under the previous law ORG could hold an oral hearing if it considered it necessary . The reservation made by GPE in accordance with LAW now DATE ) of the LAW , according to which GPE can not guarantee a right to an oral hearing insofar as the NORP laws do not provide for such a right , concerned the courts of appeal until the entry into force of the amendment of CARDINAL DATE .
